title: Behavior of second derivative with table

content.question: The function f is twice differentiable. Selected values of f are given in the table above. Which of the following could be the graph of f''(x), the second derivative of f ?

choices.label: A coordinate plane shows a fluctuating curve. The x-axis ranges from 0 through 6. The curve begins in quadrant 1, declines to the value 1 on the x-axis with a positive value of y. It rises up, peaks at a value of 3 on the x-axis, and declines to intersect the x-axis at a value of about 4. 2. It continues to dip in quadrant 4, then rises and intersects the x-axis at a value of about 5.8, and then continues to rise steeply in quadrant 1.

A coordinate plane shows a curve in quadrants 1 and 4, which oscillates along the x-axis. The curve rises from quadrant 4, intersects the x-axis at a value 1, extends above the x-axis, and then declines to intersect the x-axis at a value of about 2.8. It then extends below the x-axis, in quadrant 4, then rises to intersect the x-axis at a value of about 5.2, and finally continues to rise in quadrant 1.

A coordinate plane shows a curve in quadrants 1 and 4, which oscillates along the x-axis. The curve declines from quadrant 1, intersects the x-axis at a value 1, extends below the x-axis, and then rises to intersect the x-axis at a value of about 2.8. It then extends above the x-axis, in quadrant 1, then declines to intersect the x-axis at a value of about 5.2, and finally continues to decline in quadrant 4.

A coordinate plane shows a concave upward declining curve, which starts from quadrant 4, and intersect the x-axis at a value of about 1.9. The curve declines below the x-axis to quadrant 4 and rises through the value 4 on the x-axis. It continues to rise above the x-axis in quadrant 1, and then finally declines to a point within the same quadrant.

A coordinate plane shows a concave downward rising curve, which starts from quadrant 4, and intersects the x-axis at a value of about 2.8. The curve extends above the x-axis to quadrant 1. It then declines and intersects the x-axis at a value of 6, declines further into quadrant 4.

content.answer: A coordinate plane shows a concave upward declining curve, which starts from quadrant 4, and intersect the x-axis at a value of about 1.9. The curve declines below the x-axis to quadrant 4 and rises through the value 4 on the x-axis. It continues to rise above the x-axis in quadrant 1, and then finally declines to a point within the same quadrant.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
